headline.main: With the Afghan Rebels in a Neverland of Sorrow

lead_paragraph: TIMES have changed since ''Jung: In the Land of the Mujaheddin,'' a documentary made by three Italian filmmakers in Afghanistan, had its United States premiere at the Human Rights Watch Film Festival in New York in June. ''Then, people were still asking us, 'Is there a war going on in Afghanistan?,' '' recalled Giuseppe Petitto, the film's editor and line producer, speaking by telephone from his Rome office. ''They're not likely to ask that now.''
